oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Preconditioning of Calves from the Feedyard Perspective
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jordan, Tim
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: freshly weaned calves
concentrate feeding
yearling
feedlot cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Young calves or freshly weaned calves that are placed directly on high grain concentrate feeding can be expected to experience increased health-related problems compared to cattle of yearling age. Survey data of feedlot cattle in Texas generated by Bechtol and Jordan (I) show that morbidity and mortality averaged 7.29% and 0.70%, respectively. Work in Kansas and Nebraska (2) shows closely related figures.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1986; 182-184
